Title: Junior Analyst
Description:
Junior Analyst

Processing data is our core business. We use data to develop, train, and implement models while creating a deeper understanding of business processes for our clients. We believe that data should never be processed in isolation or without the proper context. That’s why we provide contextual analytics—taking into account what the data represents, rather than just analyzing numbers or text stored in a file or database.

And yes, we also develop and train AI/ML models, but only if they add value to what our clients expect from us.

Role

As a Junior Analyst, you will work closely with senior analysts and managers to collect, process, and define data for various projects. This involves conducting detailed data analyses to determine data quality, performing fit-for-purpose assessments, and designing and implementing data pipelines.

To ensure high-quality and meaningful results, you will continuously validate outputs and underlying assumptions. This is achieved by reviewing relevant documentation and discussing findings with internal or client subject matter experts.

Key Responsibilities:

Extract, process, and classify data from structured sources
Develop models to extract data from unstructured sources
Build models to forecast (financial) metrics
Create key metrics to identify patterns and insights
Develop dashboards for (senior) management
Define implementation strategies for productionizing analyses

What We Offer

We value individual contributions and encourage professional growth. We enjoy working together and learning from each other. Our clients benefit from our expertise, and our colleagues develop as professionals.

Our assignments are challenging and diverse, meaning no two days, projects, or clients are the same.

Benefits:

Competitive salary with a bonus scheme
Hybrid & flexible working options, plus 30 vacation days
A young, dynamic, and diverse team with passion and ambition
Two additional leave days per year for volunteering
Choice of a company car or public transport card
Laptop, phone, and internet allowance (also for personal use)

Your Profile

We are looking for ambitious individuals with a strong understanding of mathematics and its applications. You should have an intrinsic drive to learn and understand business processes, as well as the ability to analyze and interpret data in a meaningful way.

Education:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Economics, or Quantitative Finance

Required Skills:

Basic programming knowledge (Python, R, SQL)
Ability to design and implement mathematical models
Strong foundation in statistical analysis

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT BRUNEL




Founded in 1975, Brunel has developed into an international group with 12,000 employees and a turnover of €1.4 billion. We deliver Project and Consulting Solutions, Workforce Solutions and Global Mobility Solutions that transform global projects in Renewables, Conventional Energy, Mining, Life Sciences, Future Mobility, Industrials & Technology and many other sectors.




Brunel is listed on Euronext Amsterdam NV and is included in the Amsterdam Small Cap Index (AScX). The organization has grown into a renowned global brand with more than 120+ offices in over 40 countries on 6 continents.




ABOUT THE TEAM




You’ll be joining Brunel’s Market & Business Intelligence (M&BI) team, part of our Global Sales Enablement function. We’re a lean, high-impact team enabling faster, smarter, and more strategic decisions across the business.




At M&BI, we combine market research, consultancy, and data analytics to support Brunel’s strategic priorities and growth execution. Our mission is to turn data into decision intelligence, driving value through insight, efficiency, and innovation.




Reporting to Manager of M&BI, this role helps expand our impact by advancing strategic awareness and analytical capabilities.




ABOUT THE ROLE




We’re seeking a hands-on, execution-focused data analyst to accelerate our transition from descriptive reporting to diagnostic and predictive analytics. You'll build models, design dashboards, and run experiments that prioritize growth initiatives and inform high-impact decisions.




This role is ideal for someone who thrives in execution, bring strong technical expertise, and is curious to understand the "why" behind the data.




WHAT YOU'LL DO




Client - Focused & Client-Facing Reporting and Analytics (40%)




Build intuitive Power BI dashboards and reports that are:

Client-focused: based on client-related data (e.g. customer behaviour, chum, BD targeting)
Client-facing; visually polished, presentation- ready, and aligned with required communication standards




Trend Analytics & Modelling (40%)




Perform root cause analysis, forecasting, and segmentation to uncover performance drivers
Conduct segmentation and clustering analysis to identify behavioural or performance patters across regions, clients ortalent groups




Analytics Process & Tool Scaling (20%)




Build scalable (self-service) tools and templates for recurring insights needs
Support the evolution of our internal data ecosystem by contributing to data structure, quality, and integration efforts
Document processes and methodologies to ensure reproducibility and knowledge sharing




Evolving area (future-focused)




This evolving area includes hypothesis-driven analysis, pressure-testing assumptions, and scenario modelling. You'll partner closely with the M&BI Manager to explore emerging questions and translate them into data-backed insights that support strategic decisions




WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR




The ideal candidate will have academic-level intellectual and professional capabilities, with a minimum of 4 years of experience in a complex (international) organization. Key qualifications include:




Power BI Mastery: Advanced DAX, data modelling for experimentation, visualization design and performance tuning.
Data handling: Proficient in SQL and comfortable with Python
Analytical techniques: Solid foundation in segmentation, root cause analysis, and forecasting
Experience with Databricks or other cloud platforms(e.g. Azure, AWS)
Familiarity with data governance
Active listening & business communication
Growth mindset: Curious, adaptable, and open to learning advanced modelling and strategic analytics techniques
Model development: Exposure to or interest in building scenario models and statistical testing
Bachelor’s or Master’s in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field




INTERVIEW PROCESS




Two interviews and an online assessment




WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU




Competitive base salary
Hybrid (3 days in the office) & flexible working
Coaching and mentoring through weekly check-ins
Friendly, collaborative & supportive team environment
Laptop and smart phone with Microsoft powered IT tools
Benefits; including pension scheme, group health insurance, 26 paid vacation days with the option to buy upto 40 vacation days per year, travel allowance scheme, bicycle lease plan, gym discount
Through the Brunel Academy - Brunel's learning & development programme - you have every opportunity to continue to develop yourself, both professionally and personally
Show more

  • Model development: Exposure to or interest in building scenario models and statistical testing
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field


INTERVIEW PROCESS


Two interviews and an online assessment


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU


  • Competitive base salary
  • Hybrid (3 days in the office) & flexible working
  • Coaching and mentoring through weekly check-ins
  • Friendly, collaborative & supportive team environment
  • Laptop and smart phone with Microsoft powered IT tools
  • Benefits; including pension scheme, group health insurance, 26 paid vacation days with the option to buy upto 40 vacation days per year, travel allowance scheme, bicycle lease plan, gym discount
  • Through the Brunel Academy - Brunel's learning & development programme - you have every opportunity to continue to develop yourself, both professionally and personally

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We help companies modernize business operations, adopt intelligent automation, deliver real-time performance insights and connect the enterprise - accelerating the impact of digital transformation. Founded in 1987 and recognized as a trusted advisor, HSO is one of the world's top business solution and implementation partners, large enough to serve, small enough to care. We are 100% dedicated to Microsoft technology, with practices that offer our clients a complete set of Microsoft cloud solutions from a single global partner. HSO is a proven global leader with unique delivery capabilities offered from our dedicated Microsoft practices in more than 30 offices across the Americas, Europe, Australia and Asia.

HSO is a Gold Certified partner since 2002 and since 2006 has been a part of the Microsoft Dynamics Inner Circle, a prestige reserved for just 1% of Microsoft partners worldwide. Within HSO you'll work with Microsoft Dynamics 365, Azure cloud platform and our unique, industry-specific solutions.

We are a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business insights and decisions. Our team is passionate about technology and data, and we are looking for a talented Data Engineer / Data Analyst to join us.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes
Analyze complex datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses
Create and manage dashboards and reports to visualize data trends and metrics
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation
Optimize data processes for performance and scalability



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or in a similar role
Proficiency in Fabric, SQL, Python, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities



Benefits

Why choose HSO?

Freedom and flexibility

An organization with a lot of professional freedom and flexibility where we make the best choices together to optimize your development process during your career.

Culture

An open and accessible work environment full of colleagues who are always there for each other. We are one big HSO Team. Because without cooperation and fun, there is no success!

Development and growth

A job with plenty of growth opportunities in an organisation with an eye for your talents, ambitions and the things that drive you.

A good remuneration package

An excellent salary and fringe benefits include a laptop, mobile phone, flexible incentive plan, large office offering a collaborative environment with a modern design and free parking in Amsterdam.

Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company and work with many international colleagues? Then you can apply immediately!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst to support financial and regulatory reporting. You will work with large datasets, optimize data processing, and ensure compliance with financial regulations. This role requires strong SQL skills to analyze and transform data, but it is not a hardcore programming position. You will collaborate with Business Analysts, Data Engineers, and Reporting Specialists to deliver accurate financial reports.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and process financial datasets for regulatory reporting.
Develop and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and structuring.
Ensure data quality, resolve discrepancies, and validate reporting outcomes.
Translate reporting requirements into structured data attributes.
Support compliance with IFRS, Basel III/IV, Solvency II, ECB/EBA regulations.




What We Are Looking For:

3+ years of experience in data, finance, or IT analysis.
Strong SQL skills (MS SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL).
Experience with data warehousing, ETL, and financial reporting tools.
Experience with Power BI is a plus.




What's in for you:

A challenging large-scale project.
International work environment and collaborative colleagues.
Show more

  • International work environment and collaborative colleagues.

Junior Data Analist

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst / Hybrid Amsterdam / 6 + months Freelance Contract / Start ASAP




Rate: €46 per hour




Experience: 7 years




The scope of the consultant services:




In this role the candidate will help develop internal systems and tooling to scalable process and release 1,000,000+ 3D assets of 3D experiences. Will collaborate with engineers and product managers to build data schemas and systems for 3D assets and their metadata, robust processing pipelines, APIs and tooling to support internal workflows that speed up delivery of new assets.




Requirements:




Must:

Analytical skills, SQL, good stakeholder management, knowledge/experience on personalisation (e.g. recommender systems, clustering / segmentation, modelling techniques for prediction), knowledge/experience on customer journeys




Nice: Experience with GCP, BigQuery, Python (Notebooks), familiar in an FMCG of retail sector, eager to learn, familiar in an eCommerce environment, experience with companies that have both an online and offline sales channel




The most important things:




Analytical skills, knowledge/experience on customer journeys, knowledge/experience on personalisation

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Scientist

About the Role




We’re looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our fast-growing, international team. If you love working with data, solving analytical challenges, and developing smart algorithms, this role is for you. You'll collaborate with R&D and operations teams to turn complex IoT and experimental data into meaningful insights.




What You’ll Do




Develop data analysis algorithms in Python
Process and interpret sensor and experimental data
Build automated data workflows for research and operations
Create clear visual reports to present findings
Document methodologies for transparency
Assist in developing predictive models with machine learning




Company's profile




We specialize in high-tech monitoring solutions for industrial and infrastructure applications. Our smart sensor technology helps detect structural issues early, ensuring safety and efficiency. Trusted by leading industry players, we are rapidly expanding our global presence.




What We Value




Accuracy & Transparency – Data drives decisions, and we ensure every insight is reliable.
Technical Excellence – We solve complex engineering problems with cutting-edge solutions.
Ownership & Responsibility – We take initiative and work collaboratively.
Innovation & Experimentation – We challenge norms and embrace creative problem-solving.
Teamwork & Open Communication – Everyone’s input matters, regardless of role.




What You Bring




Must-Have:

Master’s degree in engineering, physics, or data science
Strong Python skills (NumPy, pandas, Matplotlib)
Experience with statistics, data analysis, and visualization
Analytical mindset and problem-solving skills




Bonus Skills:




Machine learning (scikit-learn)
SQL and database management
Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure)
Signal processing and electromagnetics knowledge




Personal Traits:




Strong English communication skills
Ability to work independently and in a team
Adaptability in a fast-paced environment

Show more

Title: Data Analist
HTML:
Fixami Nederland: een e-commerce organisatie en hét adres voor de verkoop van gereedschap en verf aan professionals en thuisklussers. Met onze eigen webwinkels en via marketplaces zijn wij actief in Nederland (marktleider met Gereedschapcentrum.nl), België en Frankrijk. Om de groei op de juiste manier te kunnen blijven ondersteunen zijn we continue bezig met innovatie en optimalisatie van onze techniek en organisatie. Dit kunnen we natuurlijk alleen bereiken met de juiste mensen. We zijn daarom opzoek naar een gepassioneerde data analist die ons kan helpen bij de BI-roadmap met als uiteindelijke doel het worden van een compleet data gedreven organisatie.


Dit ga je doen als Data Analist:

Als Data Analist bij Fixami Nederland speel je een belangrijke rol in het ontdekken van inzichten die onze zakelijke beslissingen ondersteunen en de prestaties optimaliseren. In samenwerking met het Category Management- , Inkoop- en Marketingteam zet je ruwe data om in concrete aanbevelingen. Jouw werk heeft direct invloed op onze verkoopprestaties, voorraadbeleid, prijsstelling, marge en draagt uiteindelijk bij aan het verbeteren van de klantervaring.


Onze Tech Stack:

  • Data-opslag & verwerking: Google Cloud Platform (CloudSQL, BigQuery, Dataform)
  • Analytics & tracking: GA4, Google Ads en Bloomreach (CDP)
  • Datavisualisatie: Tableau, looker Studio & Grafana
  • Samenwerking & rapportage: Microsoft 365 en Google Workspace


Je bent als Data Analist o.a. bezig met:

  • Het maken van data analyses & inzichten;
  • Onderhouden en creëren van dashboards om gestelde KPI’s te monitoren.
  • Ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen en analyses om trends te identificeren, prestaties te voorspellen en verbeteringen aan te bevelen (bv prijsstrategie en voorraadbeleid).
  • Data inzichten vertalen naar duidelijke en bruikbare adviezen voor stakeholders.
  • Samenwerking tussen teams & afdelingen;
  • Samenwerking met de commerciële teams/afdelingen om data gedreven aanbevelingen te kunnen geven ter ondersteuning van de besluitvorming.
  • Complexe data vertalen naar een eenvoudige en begrijpbare inzichten om draagvlak bij de stakeholders te creëren.
  • Nauwe samenwerking binnen het BI-team om databronnen te verfijnen, de kwaliteit van data te waarborgen en nieuwe analytische tools of methoden te implementeren.
  • Continue verbetering;
  • Het herkennen van kansen om interne processen te verbeteren aan de hand van data-analyses.
  • Ontwikkelen van gestandaardiseerde rapportages en real-time dashboards die snelle besluitvorming mogelijk maken.
  • Actief volgen van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van analytische technologieën zodat we als organisatie voorop (blijven) lopen.


Je herkent jezelf in het volgende:

  • Afgeronde HBO opleiding in een relevant vakgebied (Business Analytics, Econometrie, Data Science etc.);
  • Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als analist, bij voorkeur binnen een e-commerce of retail omgeving;
  • Ervaring met SQL, kennis van Google BigQuery is een vereiste;
  • Kennis van GA4, Google Ads of andere gerelateerde marketing analytics tools is een pré;
  • Programeervaardigheden (Python) is een pré;
  • Sterk probleemoplossend vermogen; je denkt in oplossingen en hebt oog voor optimalisatie;
  • Je bent bekend met agile werken, ervaring met JIRA is een pré;
  • Analytisch ijzersterk; je verkrijgt snel inzichten en bent in staat analytische resultaten te vertalen naar meetbare bedrijfsresultaten;
  • Beheersing van zowel de Nederlandse als de Engelse taal in woord- en geschrift.


Nu is het jouw beurt.

Hebben wij jou overtuigd van deze vacature en wil jij werken bij Fixami in Tilburg? Dan is de beurt nu aan jou. Solliciteer met CV, via LinkedIn of per mail via recruitment@fixami.com.

Title: Data Analyst (Marketing)
Description:
TicketSwap is on a mission to become the world’s favorite marketplace to safely buy and sell tickets. With over 15 million fans across 36 countries, we’re building a platform that fans love and trust. As we expand and innovate, we’re tackling exciting challenges – from enhancing our fan experience to scaling our platform globally.

Driven by our passion for technology and live events, we are always looking for talented, data-driven individuals to help us shape the future of fan experiences. At TicketSwap, our fans are at the heart of everything we do, and we’re on the hunt for a data-savvy, organized, and proactive Data Analyst to support mainly our Performance Marketing and CRM efforts.

Are you ready to help elevate TicketSwap as the go-to destination for fans worldwide? Read on to find out more! 👇

Full-time


Amsterdam



What You Can Expect From The Work

Based in Amsterdam working from our HQ, you will:


Analyze the performance of paid campaigns across channels like Google Ads, Meta, Tiktok, Snapchat and more.
Measure and optimize the ROI of online and offline advertising initiatives.
Monitor and report on budget allocation, campaign performance, and ad effectiveness.



CRM And Retention Insights


Collaborate with the CRM team to analyze customer segmentation, retention strategies, and engagement patterns.
Identify data-driven opportunities to improve customer activation and retention across all stages of the lifecycle.



Cross-Team Collaboration


Work closely with marketing, analytics, and product teams to understand business needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Help prioritize and execute growth initiatives using data-backed recommendations.



KPI Reporting & Dashboards


Develop and maintain dashboards to track critical metrics, including conversion rates, customer acquisition costs, and website/app traffic.
Regularly report on marketing and CRM KPIs to guide strategy and execution.



About You


You are based in The Netherlands, are an EU resident, or have an existing visa to work here. A relocation package is not provided.



Educational Background


A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.



Professional Experience


2/3 years of experience in marketing, business, or product analytics, ideally in a fast-paced environment, marketplace experience is a huge plus.
Hands-on experience with analytics tools, including SQL and large datasets.
Hands-on experience with DBT or equivalent tool for data transformation



Technical Skills


Proficiency in data visualization tools like Looker, Power BI, Tableau, or Data Studio.
Knowledge of statistical and data modeling tools (Python is a strong plus).
Hands on experience with multi touch attribution models (Nice to have).



Marketing Knowledge


Familiarity with CRM data analysis and customer journey optimization.
Experience with ad platforms like Facebook Business Manager, Google Ads, or DV360.
Knowledge of CDPs or DMPs (e.g., Segment, Rudderstack) is an advantage.



Soft Skills


Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Proven ability to work independently and proactively engage stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.



Excited and ready to join our team?

TicketSwap is looking for the best and motivated talent out there no matter your nationality, gender, sexual preference or religious beliefs. 🚀

Research shows that women and those in traditionally underrepresented groups tend to apply only if they check all the boxes. That’s a shame, as we want to build a diverse and inclusive team. If you know you’ve got what it takes but don’t quite meet every requirement for the role, we still encourage you to apply.

Apply now – we'll take a look and get back to you as soon as possible! 💥

Proactive acquisition from 3rd parties is not appreciated.
Show more

Title: Associate, Revenue Analytics - EMEA
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 283 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

The Revenue Analytics team provides the company with insights into what drives our past and current revenue and membership trends as well as an outlook on future growth. Internally, our analytical insights help inform our growth and monetization strategy. Our revenue and membership forecasts are critical components that feed into the corporate planning process for spending and resource allocation across content, commerce, and technology.

Netflix is looking for the best and brightest candidates to use data and business insights to inform and drive key strategic decisions. We believe that we derive a significant competitive advantage from the highly analytical approach we take to managing the company. Senior management relies heavily on the Revenue Analytics team to develop a data-driven perspective on the company's growth, and the outcomes of our analyses play a critical role in how we plan for and execute on the company's business objectives.

This role is based out of Netflix’s EMEA headquarters in Amsterdam. The role will include occasional travel to Netflix’s global headquarters in California.

Responsibilities


Support strategic value-added analyses to understand the drivers behind membership and revenue growth in the EMEA markets, derive actionable insights and feedback to collaborative cross-function stakeholders (Content, Partnerships, Ads, Payments, Product, Consumer Insights, Data Science etc.)
Assess and communicate the impact of business decisions such as price changes, content launches, and product innovations to facilitate planning and operational decisions
Analyze and evaluate the business impact of key external events such as competitor moves or country-specific events
Research, track and generate insights about the membership growth landscape
Be a key contributor to in-region pricing decisions, compiling internal and external intelligence to inform price and plan strategy
Collect cross-functional inputs to inform and support the revenue and membership forecasts (acquisition, retention, and market penetration)
Support efforts to centralize and standardize revenue performance reporting, helping identify cross-region best practices to enhance scalability and consistency in business analytics


Qualifications

A successful candidate should have the ability to combine comprehensive data analytics with sound business intuition and judgment, and effectively communicate analytical insights to stakeholders. Given the questions asked of our team are often urgent in nature and have an immediate impact on how the business makes decisions, the individual coming into this role must be able to deliver accurate results promptly. They must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.


3+ years of experience in a quantitative role (e.g. business analytics, management consulting, banking, investment management, etc.)
Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis on quantitative coursework
Proficiency in MS Excel & SQL required
Experience building quantitative models in Excel or other modeling tools
Experience writing complex SQL queries to analyze large data sets
Other coding and technical experience (e.g. VBA, Python, Tableau, etc.) is a plus, but not a prerequisite
Ability to independently extract, explore, and analyze big data from both internal and external sources to guide the analysis of complex issues
Possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, discipline, and flexibility
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Highly skilled in preparing effective presentations (Google Slides, MS PowerPoint) with a clear narrative and impactful visuals
Team player with strong interpersonal skills and a proven ability to build successful relationships at all levels
Experience and knowledge with various EMEA markets is preferred, but not required

Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Gezocht: Senior Data / Business Analist | Utrecht | Salaris tot € 90K




Tech: Azure | Data Vault | SQL | Python




Voor een toonaangevende organisatie in financiële producten, zoals verzekeringen, pensioenen en hypotheken, zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Senior Data- Business Analist. Deze marktleider, die bekend staat om zijn sterke focus op duurzaamheid, bevindt zich momenteel in een complexe migratieperiode na de overname van een grote concurrent.




Als Senior Data- Business Analist maak je deel uit van het data-klantcontactteam, waar je verantwoordelijk bent voor het ophalen van business requirements en het vertalen hiervan naar Features/EPICS en User Stories. Je zorgt voor de automatisering van bedrijfsprocessen en bent op de hoogte van de lopende processen aan zowel de data engineering- als de businesskant.




Wij zoeken een kandidaat met:

Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Business Analist.
Meerdere jaren ervaring in een rol als data engineering of data-analyse met tools als SQL, Python, Data Vault en PowerBI
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands.
Ervaring met SCRUM/Agile werken.




We komen graag met je in contact als je het leuk vindt om vanuit een technische data-achtergrond bedrijfsprocessen te verbeteren en de spin in het web te zijn tussen Data Engineers en Business Stakeholders. Solliciteer via nielsv@doghouse-recruitment.nl of via de "Nu solliciteren" button.




Salaris: Tot € 90K

Locatie: Utrecht (hybride)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Logistics at full potential

We are recruiting for a Data Analyst for our Site in Venlo.

Do you love Data crunching and reporting? As a Data Analyst, you will interpret and analyze data using statistical reporting techniques.




You need to have an analytical mindset and an eye for detail with the ability to translate this to visual graphs.




Fluency in English, and Dutch would be beneficial
Strong expertise in Data analysis and reporting
SAP knowledge and extensive usage of Excel are a must
We are open to level experience; however, you must be data savvy and ability to present your findings




What You Do On a Typical Day

As a Data Analyst, we collect and combine datasets from various sources and provide the Site Controller/ Site Engineer/Customer and leadership with real-time data reports.
You derive insights on specific business questions and act upon them commercially
Focus on SAP with a strong connection to engineering
Interpret and analyze data using statistical techniques and analytics tools for frequent reporting to internal and external stakeholders.
Develop and implement data analysis, data analytics, and solutions that support the business needs.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends, patterns, and relationships in (complex) data sets.
Define, articulate, and create solutions that help make data interpretation and relationship identification manageable across many different data sources.
Locate and define continuous improvement opportunities.




What You Need To Succeed At GXO

Ability to work extensively with Excel
SAP knowledge and expertise is a must
Strong communication skills
Minimum requirement Vocational Education in Administration, Finance, or related field, Will accept any combination of education, experience, or training
Being fluent in English, and Dutch is beneficial




What We Offer You

Growth opportunity, this role is an excellent stepping stone to further your career in the future
GXO University
My Benefits discount scheme

Unlock the potential of your future!

Your work environment




Working at GXO Logistics means working in a dynamic and international organization. A fascinating environment with plenty of room for personal input and development. Employees at GXO Logistics are in charge of their own success. Whatever your position at GXO Logistics, you will face new challenges every day, which will enable you to develop optimally. We support you in your development, so that you can contribute to the entrepreneurship of our organisation.




GXO Logistics offers advanced supply chain solutions for the world's most successful companies in many industries, like e-commerce, food & retail and industrial multinationals. In the BeNe region (The Netherlands and Belgium) GXO BeNe operates from +30 different locations with its headquarters in Eindhoven (NL).




Want to know more about GXO Logistics?

Watch the video below or visit our website gxo.com

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3P7NC8gl3bg




In short, this is the next place you want to work!

For more information, please contact Debbie Haywood, Corporate Recruiter, she/her can be reached via email to debbie.haywood@gxo.com.




Interested?

Apply via the button and leave your recent CV

Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated.




GXO is a leading provider of cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team – energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make GXO a great place to work.




The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. Review GXO's candidate privacy statement here.

Title: Data Science Intern(Analytics)
Description:
About the job

Tencent is a world-leading internet and technology company that develops innovative products and services to improve the quality of life of people around the world. Founded in 1998 with its headquarters in Shenzhen China, our guiding principle is to use technology for good.




We are not only a major video game publisher in the world, we also produce other high-quality digital content, enriching interactive entertainment experiences for people around the globe. We offer a range of services such as cloud computing, advertising, FinTech, and other enterprise services to support our clients' digital transformation and business growth.




Interactive Entertainment Group (IEG) is responsible for the R&D, operation, and development of the company's interactive entertainment business including games and eSports. Through online gaming, live broadcasts, and offline eSports, IEG assists the company in leading the global interactive entertainment market to create better interactive entertainment content experiences for users.




Responsibilities:

Analyze large-scale datasets to solve complex business and technical challenges in gaming through analytics and provide actionable business insights to stakeholders.
Contribute to dashboard development and reporting solutions using internal and commercial BI tools like Tableau.
Collaborate with product and analytics teams to develop data-driven strategies and implement solutions that enhance business value.
Assist in designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines, ETL processes and data models.
Participate in code reviews, documentation, and best practice discussions to enhance data engineering and analytics processes.







Requirements:

Pursuing a M.S., or Ph.D. degree in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python and expertise in SQL, including the use of window functions, CTEs, self-joins, and other complex SQL functionalities.
Knowledge and experience with at least one visualization tool (ideally Tableau).
Ability to communicate with the business to understand processes and tools and translate this into business logic.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts, ETL/ELT processes, and data modeling techniques.
Analytical mindset with attention to detail and problem-solving skills and strong communication and teamwork abilities, with a willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about games and the gaming industry.




Equal Employment Opportunity at Tencent

As an equal opportunity employer, we firmly believe that diverse voices fuel our innovation and allow us to better serve our users and the community. We foster an environment where every employee of Tencent feels supported and inspired to achieve individual and common goals.

Show more

About the job

Tencent is a world-leading internet and technology company that develops innovative products and services to improve the quality of life of people around the world. Founded in 1998 with its headquarters in Shenzhen China, our guiding principle is to use technology for good.


We are not only a major video game publisher in the world, we also produce other high-quality digital content, enriching interactive entertainment experiences for people around the globe. We offer a range of services such as cloud computing, advertising, FinTech, and other enterprise services to support our clients' digital transformation and business growth.


Interactive Entertainment Group (IEG) is responsible for the R&D, operation, and development of the company's interactive entertainment business including games and eSports. Through online gaming, live broadcasts, and offline eSports, IEG assists the company in leading the global interactive entertainment market to create better interactive entertainment content experiences for users.


Responsibilities:

  1. Analyze large-scale datasets to solve complex business and technical challenges in gaming through analytics and provide actionable business insights to stakeholders.
  2. Contribute to dashboard development and reporting solutions using internal and commercial BI tools like Tableau.
  3. Collaborate with product and analytics teams to develop data-driven strategies and implement solutions that enhance business value.
  4. Assist in designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines, ETL processes and data models.
  5. Participate in code reviews, documentation, and best practice discussions to enhance data engineering and analytics processes.



Requirements:

  1. Pursuing a M.S., or Ph.D. degree in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
  2. Proficiency in Python and expertise in SQL, including the use of window functions, CTEs, self-joins, and other complex SQL functionalities.
  3. Knowledge and experience with at least one visualization tool (ideally Tableau).
  4. Ability to communicate with the business to understand processes and tools and translate this into business logic.
  5. Understanding of data warehousing concepts, ETL/ELT processes, and data modeling techniques.
  6. Analytical mindset with attention to detail and problem-solving skills and strong communication and teamwork abilities, with a willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.
  7. Passionate about games and the gaming industry.


Equal Employment Opportunity at Tencent

As an equal opportunity employer, we firmly believe that diverse voices fuel our innovation and allow us to better serve our users and the community. We foster an environment where every employee of Tencent feels supported and inspired to achieve individual and common goals.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Altum Consulting are supporting a global tech brand to recruit a experienced Senior Data Analyst to support the global FP&A function in critical modelling delivery, AI analysis and forecasting.

About the Role:

We are seeking an experienced Senior Data Analyst to lead our data analytics efforts. You will be responsible for managing large data sets, automating processes, and creating impactful visualisations. This role requires strong technical skills and the ability to translate data into actionable business insights.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Leadership:
Manage and improve our data infrastructure and reporting.
Establish best practices for data handling, automation, and visualisation.
Data Management & Automation:
Process and standardise large data sets from various sources.
Automate data workflows using tools like SQL and PowerQuery.
Reporting & Business Intelligence:
Develop interactive dashboards using Tableau or similar tools.
Apply advanced analytics techniques to provide insights.
Stakeholder Collaboration:
Work with business teams to translate data into strategic recommendations.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Process Improvement:
Identify and implement improvements to data processes.
Stay updated on new data analytics technologies.

What We're Looking For:

5+ years of experience in data analysis and business intelligence.
Proven ability to lead data analytics projects.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in a technical or analytical field (e.g., Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics).
Expertise in data manipulation and automation tools (e.g., SQL, PowerQuery, Power BI).
Strong experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau).
Strong problem-solving and communication skills.

Please contact George Brown on the attached details to discuss this role further.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ben jij een gedreven Data Analist met een passie voor de financiële wereld die graag de cruciale rol heeft in de transformatie van onze opdrachtgevers naar het worden van meer data-driven? Wil je impact hebben door data te vertalen naar waardevolle inzichten en besluitvorming? Dan is deze rol als Data Analist binnen onze organisatie iets voor jou!




Data Analist




Als Data Analist speel je een cruciale rol in de transformatie van onze opdrachtgevers naar data-gedreven organisaties. Je identificeert de informatiebehoeften van de business en vertaalt deze naar relevante data-oplossingen. Met jouw technische expertise verzamel en analyseer je data en zet je deze om in waardevolle inzichten.

In jouw rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het integreren van klantdata met andere databronnen en het omzetten van deze gegevens in actionable insights. Je ontwikkelt en optimaliseert zowel nieuwe als bestaande dashboards die onze opdrachtgevers ondersteunen. Hierbij identificeer je nieuwe databronnen, valideer je de verzamelde data en presenteer je deze op een overzichtelijke manier. Dankzij jouw analyses en inzichten kunnen onze opdrachtgevers hun proposities en processen verder verbeteren.

Je werkt nauw samen met je eigen team en diverse teams bij onze opdrachtgevers, waarbij je hen ondersteunt en adviseert op zowel tactisch als strategisch niveau.




Wat bieden we jou?




Jouw gedrevenheid binnen Novisource wordt beloond. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij je kunt blijven ontwikkelen en kunt doorgroeien. Jij bent daarin altijd in de lead! Naast vakinhoudelijke opleidingen bieden wij ook cursussen en trainingen op het gebied van diverse methodieken en vaardigheden aan. Daarnaast:

Een salarisrange van € 4.500,- tot € 6.500,- bruto per maand (afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring) en een aantrekkelijke bonusregeling
Een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget
Laptop, vaste onkostenvergoeding en telefoonvergoeding
Direct een vast dienstverband
Leaseauto of reiskostenvergoeding
Verbinding is één van onze kernwaarden, we investeren dus gedurende het hele jaar in inhoudelijke, inspirerende en vooral leuke events
Een hybride werk cultuur. We vinden elkaar zeker op ons gezellige kantoor in Amsterdam (vlakbij station Bijlmer Arena), maar stimuleren eigen verantwoordelijkheid en flexibiliteit




Wat neem je mee?




Je bent nieuwsgierig van aard, denkt graag in oplossingen en bent resultaat gedreven. Uiteraard heb je een goed ontwikkeld organisatiebewustzijn en daarnaast neem jij onderstaande mee:

HBO/WO gediplomeerd
Minimaal 4 jaar ervaring binnen de financiële dienstverlening op het gebied van data
Je hebt een sterk analytisch denkvermogen en bent communicatief vaardig
Je hebt eerder gewerkt in een Scrum/Agile omgeving (sterke pré)
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift
Aantoonbare ervaring met de financiële sector
Ervaring met het werken binnen multidisciplinaire teams




Over Novisource

Novisource is een kleinschalige, ambitieuze en persoonlijke consultancy-organisatie. We bemiddelen intelligente, gedreven en gepassioneerde consultants die meebouwen aan de (digitale) verandering van morgen. Vooralsnog met name in de financiële sector, maar we werken hard aan uitbreiding van onze klantenportefeuille. We geloven dat onze expertises ook in andere sectoren hard nodig zijn en willen zo meer diversiteit bieden aan onze consultants wat betreft werkomgeving en opdrachten.

Daarnaast zitten we als organisatie zelf ook in een veranderproces, waarin we professionaliseren om de volgende stap te kunnen zetten in kwaliteit, zowel richting onze mensen als richting onze klanten. Houd je van ondernemen, meebouwen, de dynamiek die hoort bij groei en van direct verschil en resultaat zien van het werk dat je doet?

Dan is deze rol geknipt voor jou.

Show more

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
Get acquainted with Eurofiber: the lifeline for the digital society. We consider it as our responsibility to help shape the digital society of the future and steer it in the right direction. Thanks to our connectivity and cloud solutions we ensure, among other things, that critical organizations, such as hospitals, schools and government agencies, are always up and running.




Job Description

As Commercial Data Analyst at Eurofiber, you'll be at the heart of driving commercial success across our organization. This pivotal role serves as the crucial link between sales and marketing teams, leveraging your analytical skills to optimize performance and identify growth opportunities.

As a self-motivated and proactive individual, you'll manage multiple activities while maintaining a big-picture perspective.

Your ability to collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders, both internally and externally, will be key to aligning and executing commercial plans.

If you're passionate about data-driven decision-making, have a knack for identifying market trends, and thrive in a dynamic environment where your insights can directly impact business growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact at Eurofiber.

You will work in the Marketing Team and work with several international Commercial Business Units.

Core activities & responsibilities

Analyze market trends and customer behavior, leveraging internal and external data sources to improve commercial activities and strategies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities, create data-driven business cases, and support strategic decision-making, including network rollout initiatives.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to support marketing campaigns, customer retention, and lead generation efforts.
Support marketing and sales with targeted base and prospect selections, along with data-driven insights to optimize campaigns and decision-making.
Perform extensive (geospatial) analytics and statistical modelling on large datasets to identify market/business sector trends, customer buying patterns, etc. to support business, product development, and marketing decisions.
Engage in and develop data science projects that enhance the commercial performance of marketing and sales initiatives (churn prediction, cross-sell prediction, sales optimalization analysis).
Automate data processes, acquire and integrate datasets, and create visualizations to support and enhance data-driven initiatives.




Why you want to work at Eurofiber

Eurofiber gives you confidence. This gives you the freedom to decide for yourself how to do your work and reach your goals together with your colleagues. That’s our guiding principle. You’re in the driver’s seat, so how you develop yourself personally and professionally is up to you. Countless opportunities for you to explore. After all, the better you do, the more we can all achieve together.




This means:

A salary tailored to your talent, a bonus and a 13th month;
Work/life balance;
Actively develop your skills and competences through a wide range of training opportunities;
29 holidays a year with us, based on a 40 hour workweek.




Minimum qualifications

Master's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, or another quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in data analysis and reporting, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis, or a related function, or an advanced degree.
Experience in data visualisation, data modelling, big data analytics and programming languages, like: Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with data analytics and reporting tools, e.g. PowerBI.
Familiarity with MS Office, expert level MS Excel and PowerPoint.
Dutch native and proficient in spoken and written English.




Preferred qualifications

Strong communication, presentation and negotiation skills, including towards senior management.
Ability to self-direct work in an unstructured environment.
Experience with data science and engineering tools, e.g. Azure ML.




READY FOR YOUR NEXT STEP?

We see talent in everyone and believe that Eurofiber is a place where that talent can flourish. Are you ready to join us? Please send us your cv as soon as possible.

Working for Eurofiber means contributing to the digitalization of our society. Being part of an organization that strives to work in a 100% climate-proof and circular way.




DIVERSITY STATEMENT

As the engine of the digital society, we play a vital role in unleashing the full potential of people. At Eurofiber diversity, equity and inclusion are at the core of that potential. Our commitment to these values are vital. We believe that different perspectives within teams help us to provide smart solutions to companies, government bodies and non-profit organizations .Therefore we would love to meet any candidate with unique skills, opinions and ideas. Those who feel free to be themselves, collaborate and learn from others. Whether you're part of our IT or Engineering team, we are looking for new colleagues who live by our core values, and who are willing to carry these out in their daily work.

Our commitment to these values are vital. Whether you're part of our IT or Engineering team, we are looking for new colleagues who live by our core values, and who are willing to carry these out in their daily work.

Title: BI-expert
HTML:
Heb jij een passie voor data, technologie, en het leveren van inzichtelijke rapportages? Ben jij een gedreven professional die met enthousiasme dashboards en rapportages ontwikkelt in Power BI? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!


Jouw invloed én betrokkenheid

Bij Zeeuw & Zeeuw speel je als Business Intelligence Specialist een cruciale rol in het vormgeven van onze data-driven strategie. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het uitbreiden en verbeteren van onze bestaande Power BI-oplossingen om aan de wensen van onze interne stakeholders te voldoen.

Denk hierbij aan:

  • Forecast afleveringen: Het creëren van prognoses voor de aflevering van voertuigen om de planning te optimaliseren.
  • Doorlooptijden Order to Cash: Het analyseren van doorlooptijden van orders tot de uiteindelijke betaling om efficiëntieverbeteringen te realiseren.
  • Doorlooptijden werkorders/onderhanden werk: Inzicht bieden in de voortgang van werkorders en projecten.
  • Onderdeel verkoopanalyses: Diepgaande analyses maken van verkoopdata van onderdelen om kansen te identificeren.
  • Retentiegraad: Klantbehoud meten en verbeteren door middel van gerichte data-analyse.
  • Klantanalyses: Gedetailleerde klantsegmentaties en gedragsanalyses maken om onze dienstverlening te optimaliseren.
  • Automatiseren financiële rapportages: Het automatiseren van onze financiële rapportages voor snellere en nauwkeurigere besluitvorming.

De rapportages/dashboarden maken gebruik van de data uit verschillende applicaties binnen de automotive, zoals SAM, LEF, Rentwise, EVA, WinCar en AFAS. Jouw taak is om deze datasets te onderhouden, optimaliseren en verder uit te breiden, zodat onze stakeholders altijd toegang hebben tot de meest relevante en actuele inzichten.

Als onderdeel van ons team krijg je ook de kans om te werken aan innovatieve projecten op het gebied van robotisering, AI en het ontwikkelen van een datawarehouse.


Jouw deskundigheid en ambitie

  • Een afgeronde hbo-opleiding;
  • Kennis van Power BI & DAX;
  • Kennis van SQL is een pré;
  • Een proactieve houding en vindt het leuk om te overleggen met eindgebruikers, managers, en directie over hun specifieke wensen en behoeften;
  • Enige kennis van bedrijfsprocessen binnen de automotive;
  • Een sterk analytisch vermogen en oog voor detail.


Wij maken je blij met

  • Onze belofte ook flexibel met je mee te denken tot jij ook echt blij bent!;
  • Goed salaris;
  • Ontwikkeling, veel toekomstperspectief!;
  • Leuke collega’s en werken in een team met kennis van A tot Z;
  • Gezonde en grote werkgever, maar met het familiegevoel;
  • Blijf fit en schaats, wandel, loop of basketbal mee.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about bridging the gap between business needs and IT data solutions? Do you enjoy translating business needs into actionable insights through tools in BI and reporting? Are you excited about joining a new, innovative role in an international environment where your advice will drive impactful change?

We are expanding our Data team! In this exciting new role, you will play a key part in driving value for our organization by acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions, specializing in the Business Intelligence (BI) and Reporting domain. This is a unique opportunity to shape your role, taking on significant responsibility and making a direct impact on the business. You will advise and implement strong technical solutions, contributing to the growth and success of the organization.

What makes this role even more exciting is the diversity of your stakeholders: ranging from headquarters to regional teams and local businesses. You will be involved in innovative projects, taking on new challenges that offer great opportunities for personal and professional growth.

We are looking for a talented new colleague to join us as our next:

Data Analyst

In this role you will be part of a talented and skilled data team. You will report to the Lead BI and EAI and collaborate closely with various stakeholders across our dynamic and growing company.

The tasks and responsibilities are:


Collaboration with business stakeholders for the definition and establishment of KPIs, metrics, and analytical requirements.
Translation of complex data requirements into clear, actionable recommendations for the business.
Coordination with Data Engineering teams for smooth workflow and data integration.
Design and development of automated reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Analysis of large datasets for the identification of trends, patterns, and insights for decision-making.
Assurance of data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across all reports.
Streamlining of processes for data collection and reporting.
Training and support for teams in the use of reports and dashboards.
Presentation of findings and insights to senior management and stakeholders.



About You


We are looking for a data wizard with strong business and people skills with the following background and experience:
You have at least a Bachelor degree in IT, Data science or a related field.
At least 4 years of working experience in a Data/Business Analyst or similar role.
Strong proficiency and interest in SQL & Python for querying, data extraction, and analysis.
Expertise in data visualization and reporting tools, particularly Power BI.
Experience with Agile/Scrum teams and working with SAP ECC or SAP S4HANA is a plus.
Excellent proficiency in the English language, both spoken and written.
You are strong in ‘translating’ technical data to non-technical teams and the other way around.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
You are data savvy, pragmatic and enjoy to work with different various and international stakeholders.



What We Offer


A competitive reward package, including bonus eligibility.
A collaborative, international, and commercial environment where you can make a meaningful impact.
Opportunities for continuous professional development and growth.
A dynamic team culture that values integrity, efficiency, and open communication.



We are the creator of drinks. We take great pride in creating world-class beverages, partnering with top retailers and brands across Europe, North America, and Australia to produce drinks that you love every day.

Do you want to see your drinks on every table? Do you want to join our exciting journey?

 

Recruitment process

Are you interested in this open position, feel free to send your application!

In case of any questions with regards to the position, you may reach out to Yasimin Harput (Corporate Recruiter Group/HQ)

Phone: 010 440 5100

E-mail: yasimin.harput@refresco.com

Additionally: we have great pleasure in getting in touch with potential new employees directly. For this reason we are fully managing the search for this role in-house and will not be needing any external assistance (agencies e.g.).

  • We are looking for a data wizard with strong business and people skills with the following background and experience:
  • You have at least a Bachelor degree in IT, Data science or a related field.
  • At least 4 years of working experience in a Data/Business Analyst or similar role.
  • Strong proficiency and interest in SQL & Python for querying, data extraction, and analysis.
  • Expertise in data visualization and reporting tools, particularly Power BI.
  • Experience with Agile/Scrum teams and working with SAP ECC or SAP S4HANA is a plus.
  • Excellent proficiency in the English language, both spoken and written.
  • You are strong in ‘translating’ technical data to non-technical teams and the other way around.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • You are data savvy, pragmatic and enjoy to work with different various and international stakeholders.


What We Offer

  • A competitive reward package, including bonus eligibility.
  • A collaborative, international, and commercial environment where you can make a meaningful impact.
  • Opportunities for continuous professional development and growth.
  • A dynamic team culture that values integrity, efficiency, and open communication.


We are the creator of drinks. We take great pride in creating world-class beverages, partnering with top retailers and brands across Europe, North America, and Australia to produce drinks that you love every day.

Do you want to see your drinks on every table? Do you want to join our exciting journey?

 

Recruitment process

Are you interested in this open position, feel free to send your application!

In case of any questions with regards to the position, you may reach out to Yasimin Harput (Corporate Recruiter Group/HQ)

Phone: 010 440 5100

E-mail: yasimin.harput@refresco.com

Additionally: we have great pleasure in getting in touch with potential new employees directly. For this reason we are fully managing the search for this role in-house and will not be needing any external assistance (agencies e.g.).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Why work at Nebius

Nebius is leading a new era in cloud computing to serve the global AI economy. We create the tools and resources our customers need to solve real-world challenges and transform industries, without massive infrastructure costs or the need to build large in-house AI/ML teams. Our employees work at the cutting edge of AI cloud infrastructure alongside some of the most experienced and innovative leaders and engineers in the field.




Where we work

Headquartered in Amsterdam and listed on Nasdaq, Nebius has a global footprint with R&D hubs across Europe, North America, and Israel. The team of over 800 employees includes more than 400 highly skilled engineers with deep expertise across hardware and software engineering, as well as an in-house AI R&D team.




Role Overview:

As a Data Analyst at our company, you will play a key role in shaping our product strategy and transforming raw data into actionable insights. We are an AI cloud provider offering GPU capacity, PaaS services, and SaaS APIs for ML models, with rapid growth anticipated in both our B2B and B2C markets. Your expertise will empower us to better understand customer behavior, optimize digital traffic for our marketing team, and enhance overall marketing performance.




Key Responsibilities:




Analyzing Data & Uncovering Insights:

Data Exploration: Dive into large datasets to identify patterns and trends in user behavior, marketing performance, and platform interactions.
Ownership: Take full responsibility for analytical solutions while collaborating closely with the UX and Marketing teams.




End-to-End Analytics:

Data Solutions: Build robust data solutions—from developing data pipelines to creating dashboards—that drive data-informed decision-making.
SQL & Workflow Optimization: Write efficient SQL queries and optimize data workflows using ClickHouse, Spark, TractoAI (based on the YTSaurus database), or similar systems
Data Visualization: Leverage BI tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar) to design clear and compelling visualizations.




Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Teamwork: Work closely with teams across the organization to define analytical requirements and deliver strategic insights.
Prioritization: Prioritize analytical research projects based on their potential impact on customer experience.
Reporting: Explain and support existing analytical reports.




Tools Implementation:

Innovation: Experiment with new tools and technologies to drive innovative analytics solutions that meet business requirements in terms of performance, scalability, and data quality.




Key Qualifications & Experience:

Experience: 4+ years in a Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or a similar role.
Technical Proficiency:
Strong SQL skills.Proficiency in Python for data processing and automation.
Hands-on experience with ETL/ELT pipelines and data transformation workflows.
Familiarity with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, or similar) for creating impactful dashboards.
Experience with Git for version control and Docker for container management.
Analytical Skills:
Ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and tell a compelling story.
Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for effective collaboration with cross-functional teams.
Work Style: A structured, independent approach to solving data challenges.
Educational Background: A background in Mathematics and Economics is an advantage.




Preferred qualifications:

Experience with marketing and UX analytics.
Experience with Google Analytics or similar products.
Knowledge of A/B testing, customer segmentation, and behavior analysis.




Why Join Us?




Shape the Future: Be at the forefront of AI-driven cloud analytics in a fast-growing company.
End-to-End Ownership: Manage the full analytics process from data ingestion to insights.
Impact: See your work drive strategic decisions and fuel business growth across both B2B and B2C markets.
Innovative Culture: Join a collaborative, data-driven team that values innovation and professional development.
Show more

Title: BI Data Analist
HTML:
Milgro is hét technologiebedrijf voor het managen van natuurlijk kapitaal. Wij stellen organisaties in staat een duurzame omgang met grondstoffen op winstgevende wijze in hun bedrijfsvoering te integreren. Daarmee versnellen wij ‘het nieuwe normaal’ van een circulaire economie.


Wat ga je doen?

Thuis of op kantoor, als Data & Technology team starten wij de werkdag met een stand-up volgens de scrum-methodiek. Je praat je collega’s bij over de producten waar je gisteren aan gewerkt hebt, wat je prioriteiten voor vandaag zijn en wat nog niet helemaal is gelukt. Met als doel om tijdens de tweewekelijkse ‘sprint’ gezamenlijk iets moois op te kunnen leveren.


Als BI analist heb je een afwisselende baan; van het omzetten van data in begrijpelijke informatie, tot het in gesprek zijn met collega’s van andere afdelingen over een idee dat net is gepitcht en waarvoor een impactanalyse nodig is. Van het analyseren in SQL tot het visualiseren van data in Power BI.


  • Je zorgt voor het ophalen, controleren en verwerken van data. Vervolgens zet je deze om in begrijpelijke informatie en geeft hierover advies;
  • Je maakt rapportages en dashboards die naadloos aansluiten op de behoefte van de eindgebruiker, reken houdend met een gebruiksvriendelijke UI/UX;
  • Je geeft de Product Owner en de rest van product team advies over de beste oplossingen tijdens de discovery fase van een product ontwikkeling;
  • Het onderbouwen van bedrijfsprocessen aan de hand van statistieken, om daarna te helpen met het optimaliseren van deze processen;
  • Het trainen van de superusers en gebruikers in het gebruik van Power BI;
  • Actieve samenwerking met andere afdelingen voor een effectieve productontwikkeling;
  • Beheren van de enterprise rapportages en dashboards in Power BI;
  • Het uitvoeren van impactanalyse bij wijzigingen.


De ideale kandidaat

Is iemand die data-minded en analytisch goed onderbouwd is en energie haalt uit de samenwerking met collega’s van verschillende afdelingen en zich kan verplaatsen in de behoefte van de eindgebruiker. Daarnaast beschik je over:

  • kennis van Power BI en SQL ;
  • kennis van DAX measures;
  • kennis van data modellen volgens de Kimball standaard;
  • minimaal over HBO werk- en denkniveau met bij voorkeur een bedrijfskundige achtergrond. Ervaring in een data-analyse omgeving is een pré;
  • Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift;
  • Krijgt energie van agile-scrum werken.


Wat kan je van ons verwachten?

  • Een uitdagende baan waarbij je werkzaam bent in ons inspirerende kantoor in Rotterdam.
  • Hybride werken: een goede balans tussen thuis en op kantoor werken.
  • Professionele en leuke collega’s.
  • Een prettige informele werksfeer.
  • De kans om je op persoonlijk en professioneel vlak te ontwikkelen.
  • Aantrekkelijke arbeidsvoorwaarden.


Wie is Milgro?

Milgro is hét technologiebedrijf voor het managen van natuurlijk kapitaal. Wij stellen organisaties in staat een duurzame omgang met grondstoffen op winstgevende wijze in hun bedrijfsvoering te integreren. Daarmee versnellen wij ‘het nieuwe normaal’ van een circulaire economie.

Milgro is een ambitieuze organisatie waarin technologie, ondernemerschap, innovatie en maatschappelijke relevantie samenkomen. Werken bij Milgro betekent veel uitdaging en afwisseling in je werkzaamheden.


Ja, ik wil deze baan bij Milgro!

Leuk dat je enthousiast bent geworden! We zien je sollicitatie graag tegemoet. Stuur jouw CV en motivatiebrief naar Simone Hogeweij via werkenbij@milgro.nl.


In de bepaling of wij wel of geen match zien, wordt onze keuze uitsluitend gebaseerd op jouw kennis, ervaring en jouw eventuele motivatie voor Milgro en de functie. Afkomst, sekse, seksuele oriëntatie, religie of geloofsovertuiging, leeftijd, beperkingen, sociaal-economische status, gezinsstatus en/of andere persoonlijke kenmerken spelen geen rol in onze besluitvorming.


We komen graag zelf in contact met onze nieuwe collega. Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Title: Data & BI Specialist
Description:
Het data team van ANVA ontwikkelt data ontsluiting, rapportage, analytics en migratie oplossingen voor onze klanten. Dit zelfstandige agile team heeft een goede sfeer en een succesvolle geschiedenis. Wegens uitbreiding zoeken wij nu een Data & BI Specialist.




Als Data & BI Specialist werk je op het snijvlak van technische ontwikkelwerkzaamheden, beheer en data engineering. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de technische werkzaamheden zoals het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en onderhouden van Qlik Sense omgevingen. Daarnaast werk je aan het bouwen van robuuste data oplossingen in Snowflake en Matillion met AWS. Je werkt nauw samen met collega’s en gebruikers om de dataketen te optimaliseren en bruikbare inzichten te leveren.




Eisen

HBO- of WO-opleiding in een relevante richting
Vloeiende beheersing van de nederlandse taal
5 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare rol in een Data gestuurde omgeving
Ervaring met Qlik Sense Cloud, inclusief scripting en data modeling
Sterke SQL-vaardigheden en ervaring met ETL-processen
Kennis/ ervaring met Snowflake of vergelijkbaar cloud product (pre)
Ervaring met programmeertalen zoals Python of R (pre).
Show more

Title: Data-analist
HTML:
Jumbo heeft met 700 winkels in Nederland en België, en de mogelijkheid tot thuisbezorging via Jumbo.nl een stevige positie in de markt. De ambitie van Jumbo is om het meest klantgerichte bedrijf te zijn. Dit willen ze bereiken door klanten te verrassen en verwachtingen te overtreffen, zodat klanten met plezier hun boodschappen bij Jumbo doen. De klantbeleving staat dan ook centraal en Jumbo is continu bezig om dit te verbeteren. Daarbij is het noodzakelijk om met behulp van de beschikbare data inzicht te hebben in de performance van de winkels en Jumbo.nl. Om dit te realiseren is er behoefte aan een gedreven Data Analist


Als Data Analist heb je veel afstemming met je collega’s en vorm je de spil tussen data, processen en besluitvorming. Je zal veel werken met Anaplan, een cloud-based planningstool die wordt gebruikt voor enterprise performance management (EPM) en geïntegreerde bedrijfsplanning (Integrated Business Planning, IBP). Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen, analyseren en optimaliseren van Anaplan modellen en dashboards. Door middel van data analyse en modellering draag je bij aan de strategische besluitvorming van Jumbo en help je verschillende teams, zoals finance, sales en supply chain om beter te plannen en te forecasten. Je bent onderdeel van het team Financial Planning & Analysis Controlling (FP&A), onderdeel van de afdeling Group Finance.


Verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Het ontwerpen, analyseren en optimaliseren van modellen en dashboards;
  • Optimaliseren van bestaande Anaplan-processen en implementeren van nieuwe functionaliteiten.
  • Ondersteunen van stakeholders bij het gebruik van Anaplan-dashboards en rapportages.
  • Samenwerken met interne afdelingen (finance, sales, supply chain) om hun behoeften te begrijpen en te vertalen naar datagedreven oplossingen.
  • Bewaken van de datakwaliteit en zorgen voor nauwkeurige, realtime data-integratie met andere systemen (zoals ERP en/of CRM).


Profiel:

  • Een afgeronde, revelante Bachelor/Master opleiding (bijvoorbeeld Data Science, Bedrijfskunde, Finance of IT).
  • Minimaal 2-5 jaar relevante werkervaring;
  • Sterke analytische vaardigheden en ervaring met datamodellering- en analyse;
  • Ervaring met Anaplan of andere planningstools is gewenst (bijv. SAP Analytics Cloud, Cube, Onestream of Workday);
  • Kennis van databases of programmeertalen (bijv. SQL, Python) is gewenst;
  • Kennis van MS Power BI en/of MS Azure is gewenst;
  • Een proactieve houding en de drive om processen continu te verbeteren.


Aanbod:

  • Een uitdagende functie met volop doorgroeimogelijkheden in een informele organisatie met een zeer prettige werksfeer;
  • Goede arbeidsvoorwaarden, salarisindicatie EUR 4500,- tot EUR 6500,- per maand, afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring;
  • Een contract voor 32-40 uur per week met de mogelijkheid om hybride te werken;
  • 30 vakantiedagen (met de mogelijkheid tot aan- of verkoop van vakantiedagen) en 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Een jaarlijkse bonus van max 7,5% van je jaarsalaris op basis van organisatie-doelstellingen;
  • Collectieve pensioenregeling (Bedrijfstakpensioenfonds voor het Levensmiddelenbedrijf);
  • Een tegemoetkoming in je reiskosten (€ 0,21 cent per kilometer met een max. van 35 kilometer enkele reis);
  • Ruimte voor ondernemerschap, groei en ontwikkeling. Niet alleen in je werkzaamheden maar ook via de Jumbo Academy, online trainingen via GoodHabitz en met een opleidingsbudget;
  • Een (di)verse lunch in het Foodcafé, goede koffie en vers fruit. Tegen een kleine vergoeding sport je in de Jumbo Gym;
  • Diverse collega kortingen, zoals 10% korting op je boodschappen (max. €325,- per jaar) en deelname aan de collectieve zorgverzekering.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your mission

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our Data team. You will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and presenting two of our Data Products. The Data Team is part of the Ireckonu Development team, working closely with the Product and Commercial teams to fulfill customer needs. To succeed in this role, you will collaborate with Data Scientists and Project Managers, tackling dynamic and challenging tasks daily as the Data team is involved in almost every vertical within the company.

You Will


Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing standardized reports and performance indicators to locate and resolve bugs.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.


Your profile

About You


Experience with data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
At least two solid yearsof working experience with PowerBI.
A good understanding of BI processes is essential.
Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Skilled in queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, or Statistics.
Familiarity with OLAP cubes and customer-facing experience is a plus.

Why us?

Since 2014, Ireckonu has raised the bar in the hospitality tech industry, with many of our solutions becoming industry standard. Led by its vision to accelerate the digital transformation in hospitality industry, we have continuously perfected our state-of-the-art product and put a powerful, yet easy-to-use CORE middleware solutions with wrap-around applications. This means we can provide solutions ranging from big international brands to small regional chains so everyone can undergo true digital transformation. We are proud to have become partners with some of hospitality's best brands such as CitizenM, Loews, and Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group

All of these are achieved thanks to the passion, talent, and knowledge of our team. At Ireckonu, we pride ourselves on our diverse range of nationalities and backgrounds and every employee plays an important role in building an environment where you can reap the rewards of your hard work. We also pride ourselves on our values; such as family, partnership, universal principles, and a passion for technology which are deeply embedded in our core. If you want to contribute to a growing business, be challenged, and see the impact of your work, then you have come to the right place.

About Us

Since 2014, Ireckonu has raised the bar in the hospitality tech industry, with many of our solutions becoming industry standards. Led by our vision to accelerate digital transformation in the hospitality industry, we have continuously perfected our state-of-the-art CORE middleware solutions and wrap-around applications. This enables us to support both large international brands and small regional chains in their digital transformation journey. We are proud partners of some of the world’s best hospitality brands, including CitizenM, Loews, and Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group.

All of these achievements are made possible by the passion, talent, and knowledge of our team. At Ireckonu, we take pride in our diverse range of nationalities and backgrounds, where every employee plays an important role in building an environment where hard work is recognized and rewarded.

Our Core Values Define Who We Are

Excellence – At Ireckonu, we live excellence through our commitment to high standards, continuous improvement, and delivering outstanding products and services, driven by a culture of dedication and fueled by passion.

Partnership – At Ireckonu, partnership fuels our core, fostering teamwork, trust, and innovation, building lasting customer & partner connections for mutual success.

Transparency – At Ireckonu, we keep it simple – transparency means being open, honest, and sharing information to build trust and keep everyone aligned.
