The Bank of England welcomes applications from all candidates, but as a UK Visas and Immigration (UKVI) approved sponsor, we have a responsibility to comply with the Immigration Rules and guidance. As such, our ability to employ individuals who require sponsorship for immigration purposes is limited. The Bank cannot guarantee that you and / or the role you are applying for will be eligible for sponsorship and that any application made to UKVI will be successful. Eligibility will therefore be considered on a case by case basis.


The Application Process
Important: Please ensure that you complete the 'work history' section and answer ALL the application questions fully. All candidate applications are anonymised to ensure that our hiring managers will not be able to see your personal information, including your CV, when reviewing your application details at the screening stage. It's therefore really important that you fill out the work history and application form questions, as your answers will form a critical part of the initial selection process.

The assessment process will comprise of two interview stages.
This role closes on 8th April.
Please apply online, ensuring that you complete your work history and answer ALL the application questions fully and in detail as your application will not be considered if all mandatory questions are not fully completed.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Wetherby

Business Systems

Full time

Permanent

The role of the Business Systems Analyst is to be responsible for oversight of a number of Business Applications, including our CRM and ERP systems.

You will act as the subject matter expert for applications and their use within the business, providing second line support and maintenance, taking the lead on enhancements and minor changes. You will liaise with third party application providers to work any support issues through to conclusion, holding regular review calls, monitoring application availability and system performance reviews.

What You’ll Get Up To


Act as 1st and 2nd Line Support for all Business Systems Issues
Liaise with any relevant Partners to ensure all IT Issues are resolved effectively and in a timely manor
Be responsible for administering the Newett Homes JML Process
Review all relevant System Release Notes and recommend changes where necessary
Keep up to date with software development trends and propose improvements, ensuring that the Newett Homes brand is at the forefront of new technologies available and to help appeal to our target market
Work collaboratively with all parts of the business to understand their business systems needs and translate these into system requirements
Assist the Business Systems Manager in conducting all Quarterly Audits, in line with the Newett Homes Standards
Prepare any testing documentation and support users in UAT of any new implementations, including Patch Testing
Work in line with the Change Management processes in place within Newett Homes
Assist the Business Systems Manager in the renewal of any system and support contracts as required
Liaise with the business on system best practice and the importance of accurate Data, where needed performing Data Quality Reviews
Produce and keep up to date any System Guidance Notes in line with any changes and upgrades
Conduct New Starter Training and Ad-Hoc Training as and when required
Producing or guiding users to any relevant reporting required


We’re Looking For Someone Who Has


Experience in working within an Agile Methodology with a relevant ITIL or Change Management Qualification
Excellent interpersonal and negotiating skills.
Excellent organisation and problem-solving skills
Demonstrable experience within a similar role for 2-4 years
Preferable with experience of using COINS and/or HubSpot
Preferable with experience in using SQL and/or PowerBI


As part of working for Newett Homes and specifically for this role we offer:


Competitive Salary
Competitive Bonus Scheme
25 days holiday (which will increase with time of service)
Pension contribution
Health Insurance
Company Car or Car Allowance

Title: Data and Pricing Analyst
Description:
Join Our Team as a Pricing and Data Analyst!

Are you a data-driven professional with a passion for pricing strategy and analytics? Right Fuel Card is seeking an experienced Pricing & Data Analyst to join our dynamic Revenue team. This is your chance to make a significant impact on our pricing revolution and collaborate with key stakeholders, including our Directors and CEO!

What You'll Do:

Drive Insights: Report directly to the Head of Commercial Pricing & Revenue, where you'll collect, organise, and analyse large datasets to extract actionable insights that guide strategic decision-making.
Uncover Trends: Utilise advanced statistical tools and data visualisation software to identify trends, patterns, and relationships within the data, transforming raw numbers into compelling narratives.
Lead the Charge: Be at the forefront of our transition from manual processes to a data-first, automated approach, revolutionising how we approach pricing.
Collaborate Globally: Act as a vital link between our UK team and the global data team at Edenred, contributing to our EMEA pricing organisation and fostering a culture of collaboration.
Innovate with Technology: Take on data engineering responsibilities by running and maintaining the Edenred Data Platform, utilising Azure Data Factory and the Databricks Stack.
Test and Validate: Conduct statistical tests to validate your findings and ensure our pricing strategies are backed by solid data.

What We’re Looking For:

Analytical Mindset: You excel at analysing complex information, synthesising key ideas, and making data-driven decisions.
Effective Communicator: Your strong verbal and written communication skills allow you to tailor messages for diverse audiences, delivering clear and persuasive presentations.
Technical Proficiency: You have commercial experience with data analysis languages (SQL is essential; knowledge of Python, R, etc., is a plus) and libraries (Matplotlib, Seaborn, D3.js).
Visualisation Expertise: You are experienced with tools like PowerBI and Tableau, bringing data to life through engaging visualisations.
Excel Wizard: Advanced Excel skills, including VBA experience, are a must to manipulate and analyse data efficiently.




The Benefits – Why should I want to work at Right Fuel Card?

Here at Right Fuel Card, we are proud of our fun and supportive culture where you are encouraged to reach your full potential. We want to support you to do your best work, have a good work life balance, and work flexibly whilst staying connected; so, we have designed a benefits package that strengthens our culture..

·        A positive, collaborative and supportive working culture.

·        Tailored in-house sales training provided to develop and build on your skills.

·        3 pm finish on Fridays.

·        Holiday allowance of 26 days with an extra day’s leave per completed year plus bank holidays.

·        A day off for your birthday

·        Enhanced maternity and paternity, and sick pay schemes, and you can buy and sell holidays

·        Vitality benefits, Health Shield Cash Plans, Cycle to Work Scheme, Employee Assistance Programmes, plus lots of social events

·        Tech Purchase Scheme, discounts on gift cards, and Refer-a-Friend initiatives and get discounts on fuel

·        Finally, for those that are passionate about their own personal development, we will give you £500 per year towards your training or qualifications.

Our values

Simplicity

Constantly strive to improve and streamline existing processes.
Ensure you are in compliance with the company’s policies and procedures.

Respect

Contribute to a happy and inclusive working environment.
Working proactively with other business areas to remove barriers that may impact the team's performance and timelines.
Share best practices within the team and the rest of the business.

Passion for Customers

Ensure your positive attitude shines through.
Build relationships with both internal and external customers where necessary.

Entrepreneurial Spirit

Actively seek out change, rather than waiting to adapt to change.
Embrace innovation and continuous improvement.
Feel empowered, motivated, and capable of taking things into your own hands.

Imagination

Aid in the development of creative, practical, and problem-solving skills.
Help shape the future of our work environment.
Don’t be afraid to challenge the norm.

If you are a Data Analyst with experience in pricing - we want to hear from you!

Apply now to join our dynamic team!

Show more

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description:
Lead Data Scientist

Location: Shiremoor or Castleford

Directorate: Energy Systems

Job Ref No: R7006




Do you want to help power your career and be part of an evolving energy industry?




Looking for a role where your expertise can truly make an impact? We’re on the hunt for a passionate Lead Data Scientist to join our System Forecasting Team at Northern Powergrid.




At Northern Powergrid, we’re all about keeping the power flowing for 3.9 million homes and businesses. With our customer focused approach, we work as one team, solving challenges and delivering real results.




As a Lead Data Scientist, you will be part of the System Forecasting team involved with understanding our network and future customer needs; informing and enabling more efficient operations and network planning.




Ready to power up your career? Let’s talk.




Along with a competitive salary of up to £65k (dependent on experience), we also offer great benefits such as:




Enrolment into our double-matched pension scheme
Annual bonus of up to 15%
25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Excellent opportunities for career growth
Agile working arrangements




What will you do?




Provide technical oversight, support and strategic direction for the governance and analysis of energy systems monitoring and statistically modelled network demand data, including high frequency time series data
Guide the implementation of the strategic analytic platform, informing development and deployment of workflow tools and apps (MongoDB / Databricks / Azure)
Provide Subject Matter Expertise for data analytics strategy development and on matters relating to the application of DSO data sets, supporting project teams requiring integration of multiple disparate data sets which need to be brought together to provide useful insights
Deliver change and inform IT investment decisions so that they meet business needs




Key Competencies




Ability to demonstrate advanced data and analytics skills, able to analyse complex datasets with originality and creativity to generate comprehensive insight
Hands-on experience of high frequency time-series datasets and deploying machine learning models through analytics platforms in a Cloud environment
Customer-centric approach to data management and analysis, ensuring privacy by design, governance, ethics and best practice drive decision making
Strong written and spoken communication skills – clear, concise, engaging and persuasive
Self-starter with strong work ethic, capable of motivating themselves and others, able to work independently and contribute to team goals, holding high standards for all work output
Technically curious, willing to develop new IT skills, share knowledge and help others learn
Ability to manage workload through excellent planning and organising skills with attention to detail. Good time management skills with the ability to deliver tasks to deadlines




What qualifications and experience should you have?




Qualified to degree level in a relevant subject, appropriate professional memberships desirable
Exposure to project management and strategy development, appreciation of Big Data concepts
Experience of applying data and analytics within the energy sector and knowledge of the decarbonisation energy transition preferable, but not essential




What next?




Key dates:




Post Date: 12 March 2025

Closing date for applications: 11 April 2025

Interviews: Hold the date week commencing 21-28 April 2025

​

Visit northernpowergrid.com/careers to find out more about this and other career opportunities.




Applicants are considered on the basis of their suitability for the post irrespective of sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender re-assignment, race, age or disability, in accordance with the Equality Act 2010.

Title: Specialist Analyst (Discovery)
Description:
Description

Position at Resolver

We are seeking a Specialist Analyst to join our dynamic Risk Detection for Platforms team. This role is crucial in ensuring the accuracy and quality of data and detection used in product development and business operations.

Job Duties And Responsibilities


Query Development: Design and implement new data collection queries to support various product requirements and business needs.
Data Monitoring: Continuously monitor data quality, identifying and resolving any discrepancies or issues promptly.
Strategic Thinking: Understand cross platform risks to identify and monitor new risk signals to contribute to the enhancement of detection mechanisms.
Data Collection and Analysis: Utilise a range of skills (including OSINT and SOCMINT) to discover and analyse content and signals from diverse data sources, including social media platforms and data aggregators.
Industry Knowledge: Maintain an understanding of the broader online risk landscape and stay informed about online safety legislation.
Product Improvement: Implement opportunities for improvements within current data collection workflows and implement best practices to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Cross-Functional Coordination: Manage key stakeholders and teams to ensure discovery processes align with overall business objectives and product requirements.



Key Skills And Qualifications


Experience: Previous work in data analysis or intelligence operations is valuable, whether in cybersecurity, law enforcement, military intelligence, or corporate intelligence.
Data Analysis: Ability to analyse complex datasets, identify trends, and extract meaningful insights to support product and detection development. Including the ability to use tools such as Looker to create clear and accurate dashboards.
Attention to Detail: Keen attention to detail to ensure the accuracy and completeness of reported data.
Adaptability: Willingness to work across a wide range of client needs, on challenging subject matters with flexibility, even under time pressure.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in using online syntax, including Boolean logic, regular expressions and search operators.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in navigating mainstream, alt-tech social media platforms and the dark web.
OSINT Certification: (Desirable) Certifications in any Open-Source Intelligence or strategic analytical training to demonstrate specialized skills in OSINT methodologies.
Bachelor's Degree: (Desirable) Preferably in a related field.
Technical Skills: (Desirable) Proficiency in crafting and optimising AI prompts to enhance model performance, ensuring accuracy, relevance, and efficiency.
Technical Skills: (Desirable) Proficiency in using ontologies to analyze, input and organise data sets and interpreting or navigating network analysis graphs to analyse qualitative data.

Title: Data Analytics Engineer
Description:
Role: Data Analytics Engineer

Location: Leeds, LS15 (with hybrid working after completion of training)

Salary: £40 - £50k per annum plus extensive benefits

Contract type: Permanent

Employment type: Full time

Working hours: 40hrs per week, Monday to Friday

Do you want to work for the nation’s largest online pharmacy ensuring excellence for all our patients? We’re a market leader in the pharmacy world, with 25 years’ experience, helping over 1.4 million patients in England manage their NHS prescriptions from request through to delivery. We are Great Place to Work certified as we consider colleague experience a top priority every day. Our people are fundamental to our success and ensuring we achieve our vision to be a world leading, patient-centric digital healthcare provider. We are committed to continuing to develop a positive, open and honest working environment for all.

This is a dynamic and challenging opportunity to join a highly focused team dedicated to designing, maintaining, and enhancing a bespoke Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) hosted on MS Azure SQL Server. You will collaborate closely with a team leveraging a robust reporting suite across SSRS and Tableau, integrating data from multiple independent systems and external third-party sources.

P2U’s data ecosystem is complex and constantly evolving, making the EDW a critical and increasingly relied-upon resource for the business. As a Data Analytics Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in advancing data utilisation, improving reporting capabilities, and enhancing data accessibility to drive informed decision-making and business success.

What’s in it for you?

Occupational sick pay

Enhanced maternity and paternity pay

Contributory pension

Discounted insurance (Aviva)

Employee discount site

Discounted gyms (via our blue light card and benefits schemes)

Employee assistance programme

In-house mental health support

Free onsite parking

Health and wellbeing initiatives

Social events throughout the year

Cycle to work scheme

Green car scheme*(subject to minimum earnings)

Registration fees paid (GPhC, NMC, CIPD etc)

Long service bonus

Refer a friend bonus

Blue light card

Hybrid working

Commitment to CPD/training

25 days annual leave increasing with service

Annual leave buy and sell scheme

Discounts & Exclusive offers at The Springs, Leeds

25% Discount & health & beauty purchases

25% Discount on Pharmacy2U Private Online Doctor Services

What you’ll be doing?

Ensuring and validating the accuracy of the EDW, improving data quality and query performance

Exploring and understanding fields within production systems to integrate new data into the EDW

Maintaining seamless execution of ETL and other routines, enhancing performance and reliability.

Eliminating reliance on legacy systems by modernising and improving data solutions

Partnering with the Head of BI to develop and maintain reporting suite

Collaborating with MI/BI analysts to identify and establish reliable, accurate data sources that meet stakeholder requirements

Ensuring reports are technically and conceptually efficient, accurate, and impactful

Playing a key role in designing and building a new version of the Data Warehouse from the ground up

Identifying opportunities to enhance the EDW technically and conceptually

Driving efforts to deliver smart, effective insights into P2U’s performance and outcomes

Who are we looking for?

Proven ability as a BI Developer/Data Analytics Engineer

Extensive experience of SQL/T-SQL and using SSMS, SSIS and Server Agent

Familiarity with Visual Studio’s BI stack and ETL process, Kimball Dimensional Modelling Techniques and BI modelling guidance

Experience with Python, Data Lakehouse Architecture, MS office – particularly Outlook and Excel

Experience of working within company and ethical rules and regulations in a fast-paced environment and still delivering accurate work

Able to take full responsibility for a range of data sources, processes and stakeholder delivery with a keen eye for details

Reliable and able to keep up with a highly motivated team

What happens next?

Please click apply and if we think you are a good match, we will be in touch to arrange an interview.

Applicants must prove they have the right to live in the UK.

All successful applicants will be required to undergo a DBS check.

Unsolicited agency applications will be treated as a gift.

Proven ability as a BI Developer/Data Analytics Engineer

Extensive experience of SQL/T-SQL and using SSMS, SSIS and Server Agent

Familiarity with Visual Studio’s BI stack and ETL process, Kimball Dimensional Modelling Techniques and BI modelling guidance

Experience with Python, Data Lakehouse Architecture, MS office – particularly Outlook and Excel

Experience of working within company and ethical rules and regulations in a fast-paced environment and still delivering accurate work

Able to take full responsibility for a range of data sources, processes and stakeholder delivery with a keen eye for details

Reliable and able to keep up with a highly motivated team

What happens next?

Please click apply and if we think you are a good match, we will be in touch to arrange an interview.

Applicants must prove they have the right to live in the UK.

All successful applicants will be required to undergo a DBS check.

Unsolicited agency applications will be treated as a gift.

Title: Senior SOC Analyst
Description:
Senior SOC Analyst

Leeds – 5 days on-site

£40,000 - £60,000




We are currently recruiting for an exciting opportunity with an industry leader in cyber security. This is a chance to join a cutting-edge National Security SOC, where you will be instrumental in defending critical infrastructure against sophisticated cyber threats.




As a Senior SOC Analyst, you will be responsible for identifying, investigating, and mitigating security incidents in a high-stakes environment. You will work with a team of experts, leveraging advanced security technologies to safeguard national security interests.




Responsibilities of the Senior SOC Analyst:




• Monitor, triage, analyse, and investigate security alerts using Sentinel, Defender, SIEM, and other security tools.

• Conduct deep-dive investigations into complex cyber incidents, including state-sponsored intrusions and targeted ransomware attacks.

• Provide expert analysis on network traffic, log data, and threat intelligence to identify and mitigate cyber threats.

• Lead incident response efforts, supporting remediation and forensic investigations.

• Produce high-quality security incident reports and brief senior stakeholders.

• Develop and optimise automated security workflows using SOAR tools.

• Mentor and support junior analysts, fostering a strong security culture within the SOC.

• Continuously improve detection and response capabilities by refining use cases and leveraging emerging threat intelligence.




Requirements of the Senior SOC Analyst:




• Experience with Microsoft Sentinel, Defender for Endpoint, and SIEM solutions.

• Strong understanding of network security, TCP/IP protocols, and intrusion detection.

• Proficiency in Python and scripting for automation and security tooling.

• Experience with Splunk (ES) and/or Sentinel for log analysis and threat detection.

• Familiarity with cloud security (AWS/Azure) and modern security architectures.

• Detailed knowledge of threat intelligence, TTPs, and adversary tracking.




Senior SOC Analyst Package:




• £40,000 - £60,000 base

• Discretionary Bonus

• Pension

• Medical care




To hear more about the Senior SOC Analyst opportunity, get in touch with Connor Smyth at Anson McCade on 020 7780 6706.

Title: Data Engineer (Mid/Senior/Lead)
Description:
About Us




We’re an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we’ve been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world’s leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.




In the last 30 years we won several awards, including a prestigious Queen’s Award for Enterprise in the Innovation category for our Enterprise Agile delivery approach.




Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.




We want to continue to grow our team with people just like you!




About the Role




We're building out our Data Engineering practice across multiple levels. Depending on your experience and aspirations, you could be contributing as a key team member, leading a dedicated team, or taking on principal engineer responsibilities across multiple teams and larger strategic projects. While the contractual job title will be Data Engineer, the role and responsibilities will be tailored to your experience level and our organisational needs.




We are DataOps advocates and use software engineering best practices to build scalable, re-usable data solutions to help clients use their data to gain insights, drive decisions, and deliver business value. Clients engage BJSS to take on their complex challenges, looking to us to help deliver results against their business-critical needs which means we get to work with a wide range of tools and technologies and there are always new things to learn.




BJSS Data Engineers are specialist software engineers that build, optimise, and maintain data applications, systems and services. This role combines the discipline of software engineering with the knowledge and experience of building data solutions in order to deliver business value.




As a BJSS Data Engineer, you’ll help our clients deploy data pipelines and processes in a production-safe manner, using the latest technologies and with a DataOps culture.




You can expect to get involved in a variety of projects in the cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP), while also gaining opportunities to learn about and use data services such as Databricks, Data Factory, Synapse, Kafka, Redshift, Glue, Athena, BigQuery, S3, Cloud Data Fusion etc.




About You




You're an engineer at heart and enjoy the challenge of building reliable, efficient data applications systems, services, and platforms
You have a good understanding of coding best practices and design patterns and experience with code and data versioning, dependency management, code quality and optimisation, error handling, logging, monitoring, validation, and alerting
You have experience in writing complex queries against relational and non-relational data stores
Strong proficiency in Python programming, with a solid understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP) principles, best practices, and a commitment to writing clean, maintainable, and well-tested code
Experience using Python data processing libraries for large-scale data manipulation, cleaning, and analysis, with a preference for PySpark over Pandas
Familiarity with one or more data platform technologies such as Databricks, Snowflake, and MS Fabric. We have a preference for Databricks, but welcome applications from candidates with other experiences
Excellent SQL skills, including the ability to write complex queries, optimise query performance, and design efficient database schemas




Some of the Perks




Flexible benefits allowance – you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
Discounts – we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
Flexible holiday buy/sell option
Electric vehicle scheme
Training opportunities and incentives – we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O’Reilly
Giving back – the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
We have a busy social calendar that you can choose to join– quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
GymFlex gym membership programme




Please note: any applicants must be able to gain valid SC clearance.
